fHM4RRZ3G271lEKy5JSXcA.text: I picked up take out for lunch on the way back to the office after an appointment today.  They are really fast with take out orders and my food was ready in under 15 minutes.  Instead of just getting an entree which I would normally do, today I splurged  and ordered a side of Spring Rolls and also a Thai Iced Tea - which is jasmine tea with cream and  sugar served over ice (so good, it tasted like dessert!).     I haven't had Pad Thai in a super long time so I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai.  Theirs is made the traditional way - rice noodles sauteed with beansprouts, onion, egg, ground peanuts and Thai spices.  I asked for "medium spice" but this one was not spicy at all. (Thankfully, I keep red pepper flakes at work, so I was able to spice it up to my preference.)   The lunch entree comes with a vegetarian spring roll which is quite small but tasty.  The side order of spring rolls I got today are with chicken and a larger than the vegetarian version. Both were good though!    My total bill came to just over $11 (which is more than I normally spend on lunch) but I definitely have enough food for 2 meals, so I have yummy left-overs to look forward to tomorrow!

a2iUqH_0qndR0xyEs3CO6Q.text: Better than most of the other area Thai restaurants in my opinion.   Really Good: jasmine tea, spring rolls, pad Thai, Kai Cashew. Service has always been good.   Wood carvings alone are worth the trip.   Whenever we're in the area, we always try to plan to eat here.

0PnbCq9TvEp6oqkjg461Kg.text: My go to place for their Thai house soup and spring rolls. We've been going here for the last 3-4 years. Their food is consistent and the atmosphere is great! Highly recommend eating here.

n91UbgVBu7OCT731RWmnRw.text: This restaurant is one of the best I have ever been to the staff where wonderful and polite the food was fantastic I would recommend this place as a must if you are ever in Charlotte

Smyk4QdLVC0gUh7OJ6f87g.text: Went to Thai House on a Thursday around 8PM.  A few others were in the restaurant but not crowded at all.  Like other reviewers, I liked the dress of the servers and the decor of the place was pretty cool.  I sat in a booth by myself and was immediately greeted by the server with a menu.  I ordered a Green Tea Sake...SOOO GOOD!  It came in a little glass bottle and it called Sake2Me.  I plan to buy it!  As I enjoyed my sake, I ordered the steamed shrimp dumplings.  Totally not what I expected...two roll-like, dough things came out and it tasted like it looked...just like raw dough stuffed with lots of crunchy lettuce-like pieces and tiny chopped meat.  I didn't see any shrimp, not even mini shrimp.  I was thinking they brought me the wrong item but when I didn't eat my dough, the waiter said "You don't like your shrimp dumpling?" I didn't have the heart (or the energy after a long day of travel) to say anything except "I want to have room for my Pad Thai".  So, I awaited my Chicken Pad Thai hoping it was what I am used to.  The Pad Thai wasn't bad...not great, but not bad.  Once in a while, I got the taste of mayonaisse but I was starving at this point and it did the trick.  i actually took it back to my hotel for lunch the next day but decided in the morning that the taste wasn't worth the risk of Pad Thai all over my rental car.  I'm not sure if I'll go back to Thai House.  i will certainly look for an alternative next time I'm in town.  If I'm starved and can't find any other place, I'll probably give Thai House another shot...I'll just stay away from anything that says "dumpling".

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steamed Dumplings (hmm..)
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Pad Thai

XZZbQ38Ctk-KATB_ZfnQFQ.text: Okay so I've eaten here a few times now and I feel it's time to review.  I'm not a fan really. Every food experience I've had here has been mediocre, It's kind of like delivery Chinese food but Thai.    Now to describe my experience today... I ordered takeout for lunch as I was in a hurry to get back to the office.  Normally I would have ordered from another Thai restaurant around the corner but they seemed to be closed. So I decided to try Thai House again as my craving was strong. I seriously want to like this place but my pad see ew was just not very good. It was over cooked, hardly any vegetables at all, and I asked for spicy and there was no heat to my dish. The lunch special comes with a spring roll, well it was more like half a spring roll haha. Which that was the least of my worries but it wasn't any good. It's supposed to have chicken, clear noodles, and mixed vegetables. It had what looked like bok choy and that was it!!    I have some friends who like this place and I've had good that was good but  nothing special here. Essentially for me, it's like fast food quality.  I don't like giving poor reviews especially when the people there seem fairly nice, if a little out of it, but I just don't think I'll be back again!!

beYsFlap1avoAQVbHfhisg.text: Always look forward to going to Thai House. The Thai tea is very delicious. The food is always so delicious and the price is pretty fair. Definitely recommend the pineapple fried rice and the hot pot.

6dF3MAf33xoljrWd0LR0RQ.text: Love this place. My family has been going here for the past several years. My kids love it. They love the Thai House Soup as an appetizer. My wife and I always get Thai Iced Tea. Fried Rice is amazing. Always cooked perfectly. I have not had a Main Dish that I wasn't happy with. Decor is beautiful inside. Lots of ornate wood carvings. Staff is also great. Most I assume are native to Thailand.

pr0h5DDuTn2yW7h2BCc0Jw.text: I get thai food attacks frequently, and sadly most of the time, I walk away thinking.... meh, almost. Not so at Thai House.   I can tell you in all honesty that this is the BEST thai food I have EVER had in my LIFE. I'm apparently not alone in experiencing this, because right on the wall above the register is a sign that tells you it won something ridiculous like 100 best restaurants in America. Or something like that. I don't doubt it one bit.   The outside facade is unassuming. I was blown away when I walked in by the intricate and beautiful wood carvings that cover the restaurant.   The service is impeccable, the food is to die for, I debated even writing this review because I felt like this place is a secret (MINE!) but Thai House doesn't deserve it. So, I'm yelping it from the rooftop! (Ha.) THIS IS THE BEST THAI FOOD I'VE EVER HAD.   Great (the best) food, fantastic service, and a gorgeous dining environment. Trifecta.  When that craving hits, get in your car and immediately go to this place. You're welcome.

Y-GgZcbhJi_Ulbfd_FvgCA.text: Good food. Very bad service. Waited 45 minutes for someone to take our order. Ignored many times. It was like we weren't there. Oh, and we did ask to order many times, but just ignored.

IO9cZxD3GZrOvpE3zTr3uw.text: This was our second visit to The Thai House and although I don't remember the particulars of the first visit, this time was not as good. The food was average and the spicy dish I ordered was not spicy at all. The restaurant was pretty empty when we arrived. We had good drinks and was promptly served. Our meals arrived with correct temperature and quickly. It was not a bad experience but definitely nothing to write home about. We ordered appetizer, entree and disappointed that we could not get specialty rice. I picked out the meat and left most of the veggies in sauce on my plate-refusing to take it home. Fried items seem to be better prepared. My experience with Thai food is more thinner sauc bases but my entree was thick. We've discovered some better eating(s) in the area so this place probably won't see us for a while.

zzK8fHE5Z_avCkm9cmtMpA.text: Good ambience and good food. Have tried the green curry and a couple noodle dishes and they've all been good.  Can't go wrong here if you've got a Thai craving.

Yhkk1ejVttqdznyn_bLNCQ.text: I am 8.5 months pregnant and ordered green curry for take out from here. When I placed the order, I emphasized I wanted MILD curry since spicy food has given me horrible heartburn during pregnancy. But, when I got the food home, the curry was so spicy I could not take more than two bites. Secondly, it was not that great. It was mediocre curry at best. So, goodbye $13 curry. Thanks for making the food too spicy for me to eat.  What the heck!?

FzU-fKjtRF6ukkRFLZFrow.text: It's Valentines Day. All I have to say is the service was pretty horrendous and food was subpar(Pad Thai tasted like ketchup?! And my husbands roasted chicken was frozen in the inside but cooked through?! I don't know how these things happen....) But the mints were good. *prepacked mints*

istWZLtqGqwJNca1rSaj5Q.text: Amazing food and a beautiful atmosphere! I got a delicious coconut dish that tasted like heaven. The sweet tea tastes like green jasmine tea which is a nice new flavor and goes well with the cuisine. However it was really really sweet and they kept refilling our glasses without asking, so be careful because I got a sugar high!

FinqoXvh5g2m-x1C6D2ERA.text: Pad Thai is a little too sweet for my liking. I've tried pad Thai at numerous locations throughout the U.S. and I have to say it didn't taste bad but it wasn't my favorite either. The waitress was hovering so I felt like I needed to make a quick decision. The spring roll that came with my meal was cold. Overall not a bad experience but I've had better.

WqThxGjW3zHgvdD-pVITxQ.text: We ordered Tom Kha Gah (soup) and Drunken noodle. The drunken noodle wasn't spicy at all and the soup didn't have any Thai curry in it (it was completely white with no orange tint). Disappointing because we were looking for a good Thai place in Charlotte. The atmosphere was nice but the food was just okay. Very little chicken in both the soup and the Drunken Noodle.

2fCxTyvNzUityCD8WQcP9w.text: The food is good and it comes out fast. the turn around here is great if you have somewhere you need to be after dinner but a little too much if you would like to hang out a little and take your time with dinner. But, the food is good. The dinner portions are always better, from the amount of food you get to even the size of the shrimp. (The shrimp on the dinner portion are actually twice the size.) And the food is good.

67TrzfeR7-XadLDqUpcrTg.text: I never quite understand why some people look so miserable... especially when one works at a restaurant, where people come and dine for enjoyment.  I haven't been to Thai House in a long time, and this's my 1st visit to this location, and they still manage to have the same unfriendly, slow, unacceptable level of service as they always had (the one at University area) and apparently known for... hmmm, not sure if that's a reputation you want there Thai House.  To use up a Groupon, we had dinner there last night.  Amidst it's Father's Day, it wasn't really that busy or crowded.  Somehow we still had to sit around for a LONG time before our order was taken... this was after a seemingly non-busy waiter walked by us numerous times and never even turned his head our way AND after a waitress ignored the heck out of my "excuse me."    Food wise it was ok.  I had the roast duck with pineapple curry sauce while my dinner-mate ordered the Tom Kha (coconut brothy soup) and the beef Pad Krapraw.  The soup was interesting, since coconut tends to be associated with sweet food items; I personally like it, it's not heavy at all.  My roast duck was a little misleading considering it was more fried than roasted.  The meat was a little over-cooked, but the curry sauce was good enough to compensate.  I had half a fork full of the beef Pad Krapraw... can't tell if it was good but this is normally my fav lunch dish (except I think it works better with chicken or pork).   In all, this is an average meal (food quality wise), but the service was  unbelievably bad.  When the most impressive part of the dinner is the decor (rich & ethnic without the tackiness)... well, enuff said.

1setPdUN2ULH7KL0q_kHVg.text: My husband and I are definitely "foodies" and I am particularly snobbish when it comes to Asian food. Sad but True. We frequently eat here! The food is WONDERFUL and the service is great. The people are personable and friendly, atmosphere is very nice (elaborate wood carvings and polished feel). We often eat in, but have frequently taken food home (carryout).   I will admit the pad thai here is not the best I have had. I actually only ordered it once and then decided I didn't need to do so again. However, I totally crave their Rama of Sunset dish. We have had a number of their other dishes and my husband tends to try something new each time we go. Their Panang curry is also very good but you do have to empathize MILD if you don't like spicy food...  Overall great place and certain dishes I would say rival the best Thai places we have eaten at in NYC and DC (where we have previously lived....)

0G9GENLNPAkynPLAL7ylXw.text: Decent pad saw ew. Water and Jasmine tea are excellent. Will be back again to try some other dishes. Clean and moderate noise level. Attentive staff and great service.

cCheG95J5gxyozcu1U2M7A.text: Food was mediocre and service was lacking The old man waiter in his 60's (maybe) was downright rude

W147wqCRPeOppiQ1Dr0d6w.text: I was really disappointed in the food that had previously been decent. My noodle dish was suppose to be drunken noodle but the sauce tasted like watered down ketchup. I barely ate it and they asked if I wanted a to go box. I told them it did not taste good. Response was "oh, you like the "authentic type, we make it regular for the locals who like this flavor but next time you come ask for the authentic." Seriously!!  No offer to change it, comp it. They even skimped on the tofu. It seems to be liked by the locals which is unfortunate because it tastes nothing like what its suppose to. To each its own, but I dont like the fact that they didnt try to rectify the crap they gave me. Nothing. I wont come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy beef salad not spicy. If you know thai food, you have to ask them for authentic vs local watered down version
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drunken noodle tasted like watered down ketchup. They said to order authentic vs. Local type next time??

4yBoJUVmvZrHQ2ybKzE3vA.text: The spice here is on point! Loved the heat of the Tom Yum soup. I have been to and love the Thai house in Huntersville, so I had high expectations of this one. The staff were very kind, so it pangs me to have anything negative to say. I ordered Tom yum soup and of Thai take out. The tom yum was pretty good. The pad Thai was just lacking. The shrimp were tiny (smaller than in the soup), there were too many noodles, and not enough sauce (it was a bit dry). There were plenty of peanuts and sprouts, but the fish just overall was lacking.  For the lunch price paid, I expect better quality! The Thai tea was pretty standard, so that was good.

F0IwUXeXQ-w8UzXYaTBolg.text: Always a great meal with very consistent service. I've eaten here at least 50 times over the last few years and it's always a good experience.

iKUlfo0V5P5lFrypayws0Q.text: The decor and restaurant is nice. I ordered pad kee Mao with chicken. On the menu it stated it came with green onions and onions. When I got my dish, there were so many different types of vegetables in it. There was one I had no idea what it was. When I asked the server what it was, he had no clue and asked the chef. Turns out it was eggplant. I wish they would make better descriptions. Plus side to this restaurant is that there is hot sauce on every table.

ffdcjBQcQGqwGkBatmGHtQ.text: It was a very tasty and pleasant late lunch for me and the wife. I got the cashews chicken B8 and the wife had B 2 sweet & sour chicken. The only thing 1/2 way though lunch a couple was seated behind us who started crying and making a lot of noise. But luckily we was almost done.

ms3yqcNG7n8kF4s1QL3pjw.text: Fabulous consistent meals! I adore their pad thai whether chicken, shrimp or pork, and  the pad (basil noodles), is what I call it because I do not know the thai name, which are a wide noodle dish with a nutty basil sauce that is delish! Their spring rolls are fabulous too.

KhFM66aqEcAXeqtw-P7VTg.text: Four stars instead of five because my service could have been a little better. I came in 40 minutes before they closed down lunch on a Monday and was the only person in there. I still had to hunt my server down to get a refill on my water glass. Anyway, I ordered the pork pho and it was delicious! Excellent broth, plate full of pho fixings, sriracha, hoisin sauce, the works. Perfect temperature to where I didn't burn my mouth on my first bite. Only $8.95 for a huge bowl that I couldn't even finish! I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork pho

HR0b8HeG1i7toZ1COI2ooA.text: By far the best Thai food in Charlotte. We drive all the way from Uptown just to eat here since there is absolutely no good Thai in Uptown. Our go to dishes are the obvious Pad Thai, Green Curry, and Red Curry. Highly suggest you try it and don't forget the Mango Sticky rice at the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango sticky rice!!

bMsp3Ih-tdgQ6lmnIymggg.text: Beautiful surroundings and decor, friendly and attentive servers, kind management, and very good food.  Spring rolls were good sized and flavorful... a bit on the greasy side (as they usually are anywhere you fo.) Rice soup with chicken was delicious and plentiful. Thai Iced Tea was just right.   Really great Thai place.  My mom (a True southern belle raised on southern cookin') eats there often, which speaks volumes. I recommend it.  * Note: This review is based solely on one visit and then items we ate then.*

U-MG2pM23Vud-RiW2fESjQ.text: Food, ambiance, and staff are awesome. This place has the most interesting eating space of any restaurant in Charlotte. It's full of incredibly ornate wood carvings and transports you straight to Thailand.  Everything I've had here has been of exceptional quality and flavor.

RZkk0rHf1-m6vFmpkg9W7w.text: My first time at this place and considering it was a thai restaurant, I ordered a beef pad thai. Before I approached the restaurant, I was reading other yelp reviews and came across a few negative reviews, claiming that the pad thai tasted like watered down ketchup. Feeling optimistic, I neglected those reviews and ordered it anyways. When the dish arrived, it was red, I thought this was very odd considering most pad thai that I've seen are brown. I gave it a try and I was really disappointed. It tasted exactly like watered down ketchup. At my table, there were 7 of us and 4 of us ordered pad thai. All 4 of us were really disappointed and left majority of our plates untouched. However, we had the papaya salad as an appetizer and that was great. For dessert, I ordered the mango sticky rice and we all shared it.   Take away: I wouldn't order the pad thai anymore. Service was friendly, overall decent. Papaya salad was fantastic and so was the mango sticky rice.

t_tGLfmME3H3a-xXUnvEKw.text: Ummmm, what changed??? Went tonight and ordered Pad Thai. Disgusting.  They have switched sauces, the usual peanut sauce was missing.  In its place was a watered down ketchup sauce. I had 3 other people taste my dish just to make sure I wasn't  crazy,  and they all agreed that it tasted gross.    We also ended up with 2 waitresses. They didn't communicate so we were constantly interrupted and honestly we felt like they were being very pushy with us.    Not impressed,  left hungry.

_QjliooBruzHraE1Asgzow.text: I had a really negative experience ordering takeout from here. I often order Pad Thai from restaurants I haven't tried before because I feel like it gives a gauge of what to expect from the place. Well I placed an order to go and showed the coupon I received in a mail flyer. When my food was ready, a lesser discount was applied to my bill. I questioned why they wouldn't honor the coupon I brought in, but they said that it doesn't apply to takeout orders. This wasn't printed on the coupon (though others were marked dine-in only) and the difference was about $1.50.  I'm not sure why they didn't tell me this upfront but I let it go and took my food.   The Pad Thai itself was really disappointing. The noodles were so over-cooked that they were falling apart into tiny pieces. There was also something in the dish was that gave it a dominating burned flavor. I ate about a third of it and threw the rest away. Overall, my experience here was poor on all fronts and I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Pad Thai noodles were so overcooked that they fell part into tiny pieces.

s8InjG11QlGYl9TXK_rDtw.text: We have been going to Thai House since we moved to the area and I'd say it's the best Asian restaurant in Charlotte for a number of reasons.   Lets start with service. Thai House consistently provides me with amazing service. From their manager to their wait staff they are the most courteous and helpful people. Always nice, well mannered, and gracious.   Their food is top notch. Hands down best Thai food I've tasted. I have never had a problem with their food tasting any different no matter the time or day of arrival. Take out or dine in it's the same great food experience. I will say that the menu is a bit pricy but real talk you get a ton of food so no complaints from me there.   Overall unbeatable food and service make Thai House a must-try if you haven't already.

ZP7FCkbKtcDWuZzTeOoxyg.text: Found this place on yelp, very nice inside, very friendly i came here because of the great reviews. The prices are very reasonable. They have daily specials too. For LESS than $10 I can get healthy yummy food, Instead of going thru a drive-thru for horrible fast food!  I ordered green curry, what a GREAT CHOICE! i now have a new favorite Thai restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside lobby very inviting

5XVu1ltjt_Nw9KYUKcFWzA.text: Love this restaurant. Lovely decor, great selection of Thai dishes which are well executed. Quick service and fair pricing. They are nicely considerate of those who like the flavour but can't handle the spice.

dn7VQlPXHXuUN8BXeZUf3Q.text: Great food for over 20 years. Never had a bad meal. Can't miss for good Thai food. They will make it hot if you ask.

xJfhqEFUwa6g3IpffCyMVg.text: This is my probably favorite place. I love the waitress here.. they are so friendly.. definitely suggested...

fE5o_joh6Eu_DROOGZE1lA.text: For the last few years Thai House has been a staple in my lunch rotation offering delicious and affordable large serving lunch options that have never disappointed. The interior also has a ton of hand-carved wood decorations and siding which make it a neat place to grab lunches for work meetings and large crowds alike.   Not familiar with Thai and don't want to look like an amateur? I would recommend these simple tips:  - Thursday is egg drop soup day, which is the best IMO.  - Ask for the chili paste to add some heat to your meal.  - Order the lunch menu by number. L5 (pad thai) and L7 (red curry) are my favorites.   - you can rate the heat of your dish on a scale of 1 to 5 stars. However, in my experience these are much like the points on "Whose Line": made up and don't really matter. Whatever the chef is cooking is what he is going to give you. Also I'm convinced that my pasty white complexion helps to tone down the amount of heat in my order.   While I haven't tried this place for dinner, I would imagine the servings are a bit larger and cost a bit more.

zs--Pw4sfUikCSiJ1jDodA.text: This restaurant is located in a Pineville small business area with auto shops, grocery stores etc. It's a little hard to find if you're not looking for it. The service is awesome here. The owners take the time to make the experience personable and enjoyable for the customer. The food is good and comes out quick if you're ordering in and they have an expansive list of teas they offer.

KKdRSpIcLN4G6L4f5GP58w.text: One of the best meals I have ever eaten, the serves was amazing, elegant but not stuffy. I had their chicken tikka masala and it was delicious absolutely stunning. And their home made mango ice cream was to die for I want tubs of this stuff

sqnndHf5loTgYwR0SBHtZg.text: Well I have a favorite Thai restaurant (Thai First) but the good reviews persuaded me to give this place a shot. Now I wish that I hadn't wasted my time.  The decor is nice, but that's it. When we sat down in this almost empty restaurant, it took about ten minutes for a server to greet us, and that was only after I waved one down.  They do NOT sale any liquor, only beer, wine, & saki. I ordered the cold saki (the only cold saki on the menu) and my bf ordered a Yuengling. They were out of both...... she acted as if this were normal.  The Tom Yum soup was just okay But the knock out rolls were really good.  We split the Kai Khua and it was also just okay. I would write more about it, but there's really not anything worth mentioning.  End result: We will not be back. It was a below average Thai restaurant and they should better stock their restaurant.   GO TO "THAI FIRST" INSTEAD!!!

BoZX7R3JCiYLhxAFi4_SKw.text: Food was amazing, I'll be back. I had the teriyaki chicken with rice and salad and sushi. Service was quick and I'll definitely be back!

VD0K4BCF-7v68h7QQE-JEA.text: The service and the food was impressive l.  The selection and quality was off the hook

zIGR7FPRELBLlyNhIAHKwA.text: Amazing serene place ! I love the red curry chicken and the chicken fried rice. A bit pricey but soo worth it

fsmPgAr5uw1mIApwmSFyGw.text: I am a Thai lover so this place really hot the spot. The staff is so knowledgeable. The food is so hot and fresh. Their spring rolls and sauce is literally to die for!! The traditional pad Thai is spicer then their signature one. I'll be back !!

DG1Zi-Sns_i94RIcHn_RGw.text: Exactly what we've been looking for.  All the flavors were perfect- especially the peanut sauce!  Can't wait to come back for more.  Have a few more dishes to get the dish on.

2AymP4c13V8lBF1wG8JeMQ.text: In the area looking for a new place to try and picked Thai House. Don't let the strip mall front put you off...the detailed woodwork inside is fabulous and it's a great date night spot. We arrived on Saturday at 6:45 pm and were seated right away.  We started with my favorite Thai appetizer, chicken satay. The chicken was good, the peanut sauce, sadly, not so much. The flavor was a distant place from many others I have loved before. The accompanying cucumber,  red slice onions and carrots salad was good, but nothing special either. I would try something else next time for sure   I ordered red chicken curry and asked for a tad spicier and boy was it. Not "too spicy to eat it" spicy,  but certainly cleared my sinuses and keep the water coming spicy. I would get it again at the regular spice level. Hubby ordered Thai roasted chicken and liked it very much. He said the sauce was sweet and sour like with a kick of chili spice. It was quite a bit of chicken for the money!  We topped it off with some mango sticky rice which was good but not close to another Charlotte location that I definitely prefer. It's served on this heated stone ware bowl platter that was perfect for date night dessert. At $42.00 for an appetizer, 2 entrees and desserts,  we'll worth the money and I brought home at least a meals worth of leftover.   The waitstaff work together to take care of customers, and aside from one lady, we're all super friendly,  the last was just not personable despite my efforts to be super friendly back. Otherwise, I was very pleased with my service!   We will certainly be back to try some other items,  maybe try to come at lunch and enjoy some of the specials!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango sticky rice
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red chicken curry
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai roasted chicken

1mBBfo3k8vL8mLLB3U3oKw.text: Excellent food, service and price!!! You will definitely want to eat here if you are a Thai connoisseur like I am. The miso soup is complimentary and is delicious. The restaurant is very clean and I am looking forward to coming back this summer.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great food, great service, great price!!  Pad Woon Sen is excellent and I enjoyed the miso soup

BeK6F3T1samHrru-f8M4rw.text: My wife and I were starving and I'm the mood for   a Thai tea. We chose this place on Yelp because they had 4 starts and good reviews are very important. When we pulled up we weren't sure what to expect from the outside because the shopping center was a little slow on a Friday night. Once we got in we could see the place was busy. As you walk towards the tables you are drawn to the hand carved wood decor. Not sure how they got some of these in the restaurant? The staff was very friendly and seated us quickly. We ordered steamed pot stickers and a Thai tea to start. The dipping sauce for the pot stickers was on point and the Thai tea was nice and sweet. My wife ordered veggie pad Thai with the brown sauce and extra peanuts. Can never go wrong with pad Thai. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken. I have ordered this dish at many Chinese and Thai restaurants and I have to say this was the best! The chicken was fried perfectly and they give you the perfect amount of sweat and sour sauce. Many places drown the dish in sauce and lack in vegetables. The dish had large pieces of tomato, zucchini, broccoli, peppers, snap peas and pineapple. SO GOOD! I would highly recommend to anyone. We will be coming back real soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet and sour chicken

JcRDyVgl2yBhWiyS8Nfrog.text: This restaurant is AMAZING and the staff are the sweetest. Highly recommend the Chicken Yellow Curry and the fried spring rolls :)

I4YVhP1vhn8dGPMIKLookA.text: This was my first visit. The atmosphere is warm and exhibits Thai culture with statues and various designs. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I tried the spring rolls as an appetizer. They were ok. There were a couple of over fried pieces that I had to dig out of my molars. My entree was very pleasing to my palate. I chose the Red Curry dish with Shrimp. When I first put the spoonful of sticky rice and red curry concoction in my mouth I thought steam was going to come through my ears. I then had to pull it together or I was for sure going to choke on the spicy delicious bowl of yummy goodness before me. I braced myself and went in! I recommend that you try the Red Curry dish. The shrimp was a very good addition. My total came to $22 for the entire dinner meal Portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring Roll with chicken
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Curry with Shrimp, White sticky Rice, and Spring Roll

m5pxKiTwfioKhHnWdpXMow.text: Thai house is one of the best thai restaurant there is in Charlotte. I love the whole red snapper with extra spicy, and papaya salad. Other food are pretty tasty as well. The waitress and waiter are really friendly.

q-Z3lPlZRtoM4MapiG7WsQ.text: Very charming atmosphere and the food was delicious, authentic and satisfying. I appreciated seeing a diverse crowd of people patronizing this store. I'm a white American myself but Ive learned that whenever eating at an ethic restaurants if you don't see any other ethnicities dining at that location - they are most likely only catering to the stereotypical bland palate of the American people and essentially you are not going to be served anything close to authentic food!

t8wWA2QzQOBCp1Wmk91aQQ.text: The items i picked for example the Kung Pa and Beef Pho tasted awful. The Kung pa which was listed as a curry, it did not look like curry at all. It tasted like medicine chicken soup. The beef pho had too much garlic which was odd as beef pho almost never have garlic. I haven't tried other items other than these 2.

o_BB3nuD_1oI6UOOBamMfA.text: Ugh.  Had the Pad See Ew, and yep it was ew.  Noodles were so overcooked they would disintegrate when picking them up.  Greasy, relatively flavorless.  Spring rolls were burnt and greasy.  Years ago, they had good food.  But the past 4 or 5 years have been terrible.  Best part of the meal was the mints.  Just keep on driving past this joint.

zmFYESjbzDwV36HEwIKvFg.text: Don't order from this place! I ordered pick up fried rice with no egg. I mentioned twice & they made it with egg. I called them & they said just come back they will make a new one. When my husband came back, the owner was literary yelled at my husband!

PEg2l_cvC-9MH8m6tiOf0w.text: After hanging in pineville for a few hours I decided to make an order here.  I got my favorite green curry with mango sticky rice.  I've never been to this location but I've ordered from the university city location twice or more.  The food was ready as soon as I left the mall's parking lot.  Very friendly manager(?) and nice to talk to.  As always a beautiful restaurant.

r0g-pGXA6ICSpR3nIzN57w.text: Everything was great. Order things a level or two more spicy tho since I think they serve stuff mild.

kDSqL0bhs9lpXK4eABB1YA.text: Had couples dance lessons across the street great idea to give this place a try. I was VERY impressed. Service and food great. I am not a super big curry person but I will be now. I had a very common dish. Can't remember the name.  It had noodles and bean sprouts, I had 3 star spicy, could have gotten a little more spicy. Nice authentic environment.

F-jrwLJiZYl73oIvJb0Ldg.text: Hidden gem !!! Authentic, authentic, authentic !!! Masaman curry is awesome Staff very nice, attentive.  Carved woodwork decor is one of a kind.

s4IAddMw12lbjClq8a5kCw.text: Went for lunch, service was good and friendly, however, food was just ok. Had Red Curry and Pad Thai lunch special. Asked for spicy and neither was spicy, maybe they didn't think we could handle it (happens more than you think), pad Thai had a weird ketchup-y aftertaste. Soup served with lunch specials was not vegetarian (NBD, but they didn't offer any other options when we asked.) Great price though, we may give it another shot.

iNonWt4xOQ2K4sOhrCQpdw.text: The food seemed very authentic, hard to find thai food as good as in Thailand but for Charlotte this is very good. Reasonable lunch prices and great thai tea :)

YL5VK2H9XzoCxpWWwG2XwQ.text: The Thai carved wood and overall decor is amazing- and the service was fine. Sorry to disagree with others, but my wife and I found the food to be quite ordinary and well-below quality at other Thai restaurants we visit.   The fried spring rolls were greasy- possibly were just fried a second time to get them hot. The Mee Krob was a good appetizer except the lettuce was partially wilted and brown in spots. I usually love pad thai but what was served had soggy noodles and not a lot of taste.   Perhaps the main chef was not working on the weekday night I was there. Not likely to try again though.

W9FokiZSqeH7HL_OzAuk8A.text: I have really grown to love Thai food, and this is one of my favorite places to come: warm atmosphere with traditional wood carvings, large intimate booths , beautiful friendly people waiting on you and dishes made with rice noodles (gluten free).  They know how to cook my favorite comfort food: Pad Thai and Pad See Eww perfectly. The chicken satay appetizer is juicy and I love the slaw and peanut sauce it comes with. Every dish has a beautiful palate of vegetables.  My husband loves extra spicy and if you ask for it, they will deliver it. The flavors in the curries are so wonderful and the dished are garnished with carved vegetables.  Another favorite of mine here is the Cashew Chicken, which has almost a sweet and sour sauce, balanced with crunchy cashews, sweet peppers and rice. Once again, they will give it a kick if you ask! The mango dessert is sublime, with just the right amount of sweet creaminess. I have never been disappointed.

nEZwpTPxTIhikPwlXwG7yw.text: I can't figure our why this place doesn't get a better rating. First of all it's a knockout to look at. Someone went to a lot of expense to make this place look like a Thai restaurant and it shows. Food was good, spicy and different. We had softshelled crabs, They were outstanding. All the tastes were unique. Perfect of course not. We needed bigger spoons to get the sauce onto the rice. The fried tofu was a little bland. Otherwise the food was good. The service was just right. (I hate it when the new waiter at Applebees asks you 9 times mid bite how your burger is) The ambiance is more than pleasant. Thai House is a great stop on a weeknight when you want Thai food and a bit of a treat. Overall, my new go too place for Thai.

2ian_tITpVKS7nDN01h3yQ.text: My very first time having Thai cuisine. While the appearance was quite pleasing, it was a tad more sweet than what I thought a Pad Thai with chicken would taste like! I added a teaspoon of "red hot sauce" from the squeeze container and mixed it all around in my food. It did help some and took a little of the sweetness away. My husband and I ordered coffee...thinking it would be regular hot coffee with cream, instead it was Thai coffee, an iced coffee that was really good. Another first for us!  Atmosphere was very nice with the soft Thai music. It was easy to hold a conversation at the table.The portions were good size and we were stuffed when finished.  The service was really good and we will be back but next time I think I'll try something less sweet!

jxzMoS6X7xMRrHRKy4F0hQ.text: This place likes to rob money, every time I come in they charge me a different price...and the lady up front expected a tip..sorry the food is okay but not the service

cKNCjmoec7K4_FMLWGXQ0A.text: I've eaten lunch and dinner here a few times, but this was my last visit. I just find the food to be so-so. There's better Thai in Charlotte. The plus is that lunch is cheap. For $8, you can get an entree, soup, and spring roll. The downside is that the food is just not all that flavorful. For example, I had chicken pad Thai today. It was in a sweet red sauce, which was weird. The soup was a bland version of egg drop soup. And the spring roll was flavorless.

aRqgclen8et0bJkOT0WKjw.text: My favorite place of all time!! Great price for lunch specials!! My favorite dish here is red curry. Yum!

2IaygeIu-ZluT2RwEcJV_A.text: I have to say it pains me to give this place a bad rating but I honestly had to. The food here is very good and I will likely come back simply because of that but I will be ordering take out from now on. The reason for this is as follows:  The waitresses at the front of the house are great and very pleasant but the man who runs the food out of the Kitchen into the dining room is very rude and unprofessional. My wife and I ordered and the above mentioned man brought us the wrong dishes. I was not paying attention (and honestly had a hard time understanding what he said) but when he aggressively belted out what I assume was the name of the dish he delivered out loud I nodded and he set it down. It was only when I looked up at my wife's plate did I notice that he had brought another table's food to our table. Normally not a big deal but he scolded me for nodding my head earlier and said "so why did you say it was yours if it wasn't? He then proceeded to scold the next table because they didn't recognize the dishes immediately when he brought them by either. The table tried to smooth things over by making a joke but he immediately threw that back in their face too.   It didn't stop here either, when he finally did bring us our food he set it down in front of my wife and barked out "Is this right? Make sure because I don't want to have to come back again." As if that wasn't enough he then scolded another table because they asked for a dish without onions and he brought it with onions and they called him on it.   I have a suggestion for you, Thai House - keep that man in the back where he isn't around people because he has absolutely no people skills and you will continue to lose customers because of his bad attitude. Most people don't complain about things like this. They just don't come back.

N-UMevtBR10IgSZolvijvg.text: I had chicken Pad Thai, it was nice.  It would have been excellent if they had put more spicy as i've ordered for 5 star spice.  However, food was good, good ambiance. I would suggest for dine-in.

-xo3a5CELVI902xRaTNuPQ.text: Decent Thai food and decent service.  The inside of the restaurant feels "more Thai" than other places I've been to in Charlotte with a more traditional feel.  I dig the dude in the front with the MC hammer pants in purple seating everyone.  That was pretty fun.  I actually went for pho, which is actually Viet and not Thai and was pretty pleased with it.  The prices are a bit steep I feel considering the location and the portions, but can still find a few decent dishes for just under $10.  I wouldn't plan to go out of my way for this, but since I frequent Pineville often, I wouldn't be surprised to find myself back there again in a few months.

ivhEeeycGyz3YBvG2MIFVQ.text: Been coming to this place for years now with my family and we never leave disappointed. It's always been great experience and consistent with their food. Their staff are very attentive and always make you feel welcome and you can also feel their culture as well.

b2Z4K7TbqSg8dCE23pVB4w.text: I love this place! The Pad Thai is amazing but you HAVE to order it with the BROWN sauce..not that red sauce (it's not very good this way.) I like mine just a little spicy at one star but it's perfect every time!! If you were turned off by the Pad Thai...try it this way!! And everything else I've tried from there is great too!!

mU7RkX1b6rDZi0GmQ8RAbA.text: There is typically never a day where I'm not in the mood for some Pho. Especially with the onslaught of colder climes, Thai is my go-to for all things noodly and soupy. Thus, Thai House off of 51 has popped up on our radar a few times and we finally made it in this week to check out the fare. I'm happy to say, I'll likely become a regular.   Started with the "knock out rolls." Standard rice paper rolls with vermicelli rice noodles, tofu, cilantro, carrots and cucumber. The hoisin peanut sauce wasn't my favorite, but was reminiscent of other Thai places I've been to. These suckers were huge, too. Much bigger than your typical rice paper roll and the wrapper was a little more al dente, which I enjoyed.   The Pho....just perfect. All of the standard fixin's and just right. Perfect for the colder air that has abounded as of late.   My wife ordered the pineapple curry. Man, this was incredible. Coconut-y, creamy, with chunks of pineapple and great pieces of pan-fried tofu. Served with white rice. The flavors were so complex that each bite had a little more creamy, coconut flavor, or chili spice, pineapple and other spices. So creative and good.   The service is stellar. So friendly and attentive. Your water cup will never be empty.   Also, an element I typically don't comment on, the decor is phenomenal. Rather intricate and intriguing.   I'm looking forward to frequenting this place for many a dinner visit to come. Lunch is next!

hJxGX9ww9yxvotd4dJ1Mag.text: Dropped in famished for lunch after a hectic hospital spree. I didnt know X-rays can push the 'hunger' button so hard! Anyway, this time and many times in the future, my lovely momma has been and will be my lunch/dinner buddy! My other buddy (best friend, little sister) took off to Texas, where everything is bigger, including the club I have ready to club her down for deserting me here in Charlotte :(  Ohhh Lord, I digress......  Anyway, the lunch is served with a soup which is always delicious. Very watery but rich in flavor. Full of cabbahe and tofu the day I went (it changes sometimes) The entree also comes with a spring roll which isnt of the kind that leaves an entire sip of oil in your mouth ......ughhh. We ordered 1 entree and a Pad Thai that almost went entirely into a doggy bag! It was either too much food or small apetites run in the fam? Since we shared the shrimp entree, which was chockfull of veggies like zucchini, carrots, red peppers and a scant amount of almost raw brocolli, we ended up having to get an extra small side of jasmine rice. Its so yummy and sweet and delicious!  Overall, good service, good food, good portion, and wonderful iced Jasmin tea. I likey :)

TLATmJ5vm4OpU1pf4OU1wQ.text: Best Thai food in Charlotte and the prices are unbeatable. The interior is nice and relaxing. I order to go a lot too and my order is perfect every time.

SQnldprqbhVa-C4l7haENA.text: Food was great and especially enjoyed the Tom Yum soup and spring rolls. The service is so polite and happy. Beautiful decor.

-ng5l6YVw3byjz4a6hkKXw.text: This place has really gone downhill over the last few years.  It used to be my go to for good Thai food.  My last visit was a terrible experience.  We ordered meals to go and were quoted 20-25 minutes.  52 minutes later they brought our food out.  The worst part after a long wait was that it had no flavor.  There are much better options for good Thai in Charlotte.  I won't be going back to the Thai house.

KpQSuMudX1BsA7xe1JCWsQ.text: His place is AMAZING. The staff is all from Thailand and the nicest people ever. Our food was all amazing. When ordering the pad Thai, don't get the signature version get the Thai style. (Signature is a tomato based sauce which is kinda weird) the kang masaman curry with shrimp is delicious as is the Tom kha soup. Highly recommend and definitely going back.

Jkeg7uuqfYk8tAVyoQkCXA.text: For the emense amount of Asian decor, it is amazingly clean. Very good food served by professional and attentive wait staff! I will be back soon.

kql3mfNCibC8QSWdlUfYGg.text: Great. I always order the tom yum soup. If you like cilantro and lime, this is for you. You can also add your choice of protein. The panang chicken curry is also a favorite. It is a light and creamy tomato base curry. I order it with the white rice. Going to try the hot pot next. Lots of vegetarian options as well for those who like tofu etc. If you have an allergy to nuts I would recommend reading the menu carefully and talking with the staff. The sweet tea is also not southern. It is made from jasmine tea which I found bitter.

kw-Hca30xOjGKqoNNPpyrg.text: The people are very nice, but it may have been the worst Pad Thai I've had in years. It looked nothing like the photos I see here.  We had carry out but might give them another try if we're in the area.

YlcgTx9mdltczkEC46zq8g.text: Very nice employees and attractive dining area decor. I expected a lot more flavor, spice, and seasoning to the food.

N7rOrwvdIHdsykk1uWSSSw.text: Look, if you want good Thai food.... well look no more! This is the place. Been here approximately 5x's and every time I got something different on the menu.  How bout everything is really good. I recommend this place to YOU. Hits my spot! The waitresses are super nice and attentive.  So many restaurant in this plaza but hands down this is the best in the Charlotte area!!!  And don't forget your glass of Thai Tea!!! So good!!!

mlmHYpEo3roBnfaMW--daQ.text: Nice place for lunch or dinner.  Traditional Thai foods and there are some non-Thai items available on the menu.  We think that this and another Thai restaurant further north on Hwy 521 are the best in the Charlotte area.  Thai House at Tower Place has been consistently selected regularly for recognition in the various people choice endeavors.  Newspaper reviews are posted highlighting what you will experience when you come here to eat.  Service is fast and well done.  You can make adjustments to your meals as to components and degree of spice.  Remember that Thai food is normally spicy hot.  Ask your server and they will guide you on a scale of heat that will satisfy you.  Prices are very reasonable, especially at lunch times.  The lunch menu has some quick items and a good selection so if you are rushed, you can sit, eat and get out quickly.  The decorations are interesting and pleasing.  Very Thai with lots of wood carvings and, as the restaurant is named Thai House...there is a carved wooden Thai House in a large display case.  Children will enjoy finding things in it.  Ask the waiter or look at the sign asking where are the birds, turtles, etc. in the multiple carvings.  Very relaxing for dinners and a great date place.

77dHNh-2D1b2DtfMT9B9Og.text: Best Thai restaurant in Charlotte hands down!  Been a patron for years and this place never disappoints!  Great service...always friendly and prompt.

QLVzroFXc23buPrfnVYFlg.text: This is my family and I's go to spot whenever I come visit them. The service is excellent and the staff is friendly and attentive. The food is delicious as well. We ordered the papaya salad (my favorite), seafood pineapple fried rice, chicken larb, and a whole fried snapper fish (pla radprig). Four of us shared everything and it was more than enough food. I definitely recommend also getting the mango sticky rice as well. I really enjoy the warm rice and cold mango together with the coconut sauce. One thing I would do differently is ask for be coconut sauce on the side. Overall great food and service here!

_oxetsuaJSzrrijOour7Ww.text: This place has been around for awhile, since I moved to Charlotte.  It was one of the first Thai places I went to, ever in my life.  They have nice decor and a very large area for seating customers.  The atmosphere is nice.  The customer service was pretty decent as well.  The staff is overall friendly and accommodating.  The food is ok.  I got some type of curry dish each time I've been here.  It was never really consistent, but never bad.  Sometimes the spice level was a bit off from the time before.  The mango sticky rice is my favorite item on the menu.  It is very delectable.  If you've never had it, it is a must try and definitely worth the price.    The food is not 100% my favorite, but would come back for the sticky rice alone!

NsM06P8xlPi1pPNCUKU-4Q.text: Waiter called me a sir. I am a transgender female. My girlfriend corrected the waiter and still he said, sir. Will not be coming back.  When I ordered octopus tempura it was cheaply made. The breading was nasty and cheap breading.

BlBy4YUKMg4H0IDAIZF8pQ.text: Visiting from Maryland. Curry fried rice and yellow curry chicken were phenomenal! Great decor and attentive staff.

5TQRqNhvIDXLgcTryhwpMw.text: We love walking into Thai House where a friendly staff always greets you with a smile. Their authentic delicious food is full of flavors that bring memories back from the time when we visited Thailand. Thai House homemade clear noodle soup is my must have, especially on a chilly winters evening.

VeAfryFo2OK19U0yyqCUAg.text: Yes, this is a good place for Thai cravings! Many options on the menu, great flavors to the food. The service is really fast and efficient , we ordered had dinner and paid our tab all under an hour!.....but yes delicious curry meals and rice or noodle dishes you are sure to enjoy!

Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside decor

SrtrSTPrrzVfCWknF88eaA.text: Have eaten here regularly for 15 years and have never been disappointed. Don't comprehend how anyone could give less than a four star rating. Food is always artfully prepared, fresh and hot. Service is consistently friendly and efficient. Atmosphere is elegant yet comfortable.  Regarding the food... skip the salad and start with a delicious soup, which is a must, whether you go with the savory coconut based Tom Kha or the slightly spicy Tom Yum. As far as appetizers go, you can't go wrong with any of the dumplings (but if you must choose, go with the soup!)  My favorite entree is the Namprigpaow with chicken or crispy duck. Both come in a light brown sauce with perfectly prepared veggies served with brown rice and the best spring roll in town. If you prefer noodles, the Pad See Ew is an excellent choice but, be warned, it is addictive. The pineapple fried rice is also fantastic.  For dessert, try the mango and sticky rice ('cause it's the only one they offer and it just happens to be tasty and enough for two).   Again I love this place! (Did I mention the soup?) Enjoy!

2FljWhiZWREd1w0f0p_0TQ.text: My new favorite Thai place. The decor inside is beautiful. It is filled with hand carved wood panels. We went for the lunch special. The lunch specials come with spring roll, chicken rice soup, and rice unless you get a noodle dish. We both ordered the pad Thai - one American style and one traditional Thai style. Honestly the American one is too sweet. The Thai style is delicious. Would definitely get that again. We also saw some fried rice that looked really good so might try that next time. I've also read good things about the mango sticky rice. We will definitely be back!

Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken pad Thai American style

ClRJsWI3KNud5ZFp8LXnbQ.text: This used to be our go-to place for Thai food.  Our most recent dinner was underwhelming to say the least.  The pad Thai tasted like the kind you'd microwave in 90 seconds.  Too sweet and almost mushy.   The fried rice didn't taste fresh.  Smelled off and couldn't quite tell what was causing the weird aroma.  The fresh rolls were the best but that's hard to mess up!  Service was 5 stars.  The food was 1 star.  That makes it a 3 star experience.    Not sure if the chef was out for a stroll ... #MissingChef?

wFsC9rpAOYxgCT3-DM-T3g.text: Picked up a takeout order. The sweet and sour chicken had the chicken but we didn't get the sweet and sour sauce. Masaman curry was super spicy and the consistency of water. Other dishes were ok but nothing worth giving them another try.

SVM5ooGaWIIQ6nGEe32dcQ.text: Good spot for quick Thai fix- but not if you want authentic Thai. We ordered the chicken pad Thai and the chicken pad ke mow both Thai style. Each dish was slightly sweet- probably due to the oyster sauce. Pad ke now came with a lot of vegetables (carrots, eggplant, green onion) and was saucier than what I'm used to seeing. Only down side was that the restaurant itself felt damp and sticky.

L_zc81eY719FGpwv2SjiiA.text: Awesome fresh authentic food. The spice levels are more intense than common American Thai places. Start with a Thai Tea and enjoy the Papaya Salad when it's really warm outside.

eoRVMveQgev4AZLG6t9CtQ.text: When we moved to the CLT we had a tough time trying to find Thai that we really liked.  This place wins on several fronts!  The Tom Kha/Yum soups are pretty wonderful, the entrees are wonderful, the decor is beautiful and the staff is really great.  Try #59 - a very sophisticated flavor profile!

RDlPsea9NU0NK0kZKWKBDQ.text: This rating is only about the service. I cannot rate the food because the visit did not get that far. We were sat as soon as we arrived...in the dingiest part of the restaurant. It is an old bar area that clearly isn't used much. More like an employee break area where you would roll silverware while chatting with a coworker. We waited so long for someone to just take our drink order. When that arrived we told the young man we were ready to order and he explained that he wasn't trained to do that. So we waited, and waited. Finally we decided to leave.

ZX40eTxbI1c3V5ycqFHd1Q.text: Beautiful atmosphere, great food, very healthy and fresh. The wait staff was super  friendly and the service was fast.

UAJi6m0BE25Y_nTVC94gGQ.text: This was good but, but not a Nee York moment meal. It gets 3 stars cause it wasn't over spiced etc. which was one of my issues since there was no real taste.  Spring rolls were a bit greasy and bland. The wide noodles were ok, but it was good I have to say compared to the ones I've tried down here since I left NY. I would go back again if I can't find a place closer to me

4kMzw0gny4YVGZfyNKKYuA.text: I have alway love love the food here. You want Thai food. This is place to go too. Straight forward. No sushi or Chinese dishes. 2 of my favorite dishes   1) yellow curry with coconut milk, potatoes, onions and peanuts with chicken. I never get it spicy. Very creamy and filling.  2) the pineapple fries with the Chinese sausages. This is THE ONLY place that offered Chinese  sausages. Something I grew eating and it's perfect with fried rice. Of course, pork and pineapple goes well with each other!  3) there special iced Thai Coffee. Coffee, cream and sugar. I'm not sure if it's special coffee but it's close to Vietnamese coffee. Not as strong tho.   I took the one star away because of the customer service. Every time I come, it's alway something. She got the order wrong. They charge us wrong. Asked the wrong question,, I just wish they pay a little more to the details!!

coVgEjdMuDdOCuRJiFN_Xg.text: Nice authentic thai restaurant. They are consistent with their flavor. Their green curry is worth trying.

mdgHi4T_ZE-SjwxvmAcs3w.text: What an awesome little place!! The food was fantastic - we especially loved the green curry and the Thai spring rolls. The spicy chili sauce on the table is nice too. The decor is so intricate and ornate and the staff was very friendly. We will definitely be back!

OT1yT_n7vLzYsPf_-P5c4Q.text: This is a great place for Thai dining. I tried some new dishes and found it hard to stop even though I was getting full. The people here are so kind and the atmosphere relaxing. There was a steady flow of people coming in for dine and takeout even at 3in the afternoon. Thank you for a great meal!

qwjcy9eUR1mo9uUEVdWWVQ.text: This is a good restaurant with Thai Food, good service and foods also yummy. I'd like to try other food again

Hopefully I can squeeze out some more visits here because I just can't get enough.

HIBhAA8A9DNALg157KVPyw.text: Thai places can be swing or miss. This place was a nice surprise.  Me and some work buddies stumbled in here one Friday because we got to Mr. Tokyo too late to get a seat but we wanted Asian for lunch and only had an hour or so to be back to work.  It was very pleasant, I noticed they have a bar for dinner and weekends, the staff was very friendly and the vibe was really nice. Decorations were very easy going and gave a good Thai/Asian feel.  They gave us some complimentary chicken noodle soup while we reviewed the menu, and it was really nice on a cold day. Nothing crazy but definitely nothing to complain about.  The menu was simple and sweet with some lunch specials that were really nicely priced. My whole thing is that when you go out to a new  Thai place you have to try their Pad Thai the first time. If they cannot nail this nothing else will probably be good.  I told her she could make it as spicy as they want. It came out shortly after we finished the soup and the dish was beautiful. I wish I had taken some pictures but I couldn't wait to dive in. They had the perfect amount of ingredients on the plate( not too many bean sprouts and onion like some places) , the chicken was excellent so tasty and the sauce had just the right amount of peanut flavor.  The plate comes out assembled like it's right off the wok on a street cart like I remember from little Asia. So you get the right to stir it up how you want.  It was spicy and delicious and she even gave me a bottle of in house mad chilli sauce to add myself. I was in heaven,  stuffed and sweating when I left.  I will definitely be back soon to try more menu items and if I ever have a sitter want to drive up to Charlotte for dinner.  Thanks and good job.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

IRtbWw-5I_hebqlMdliAOQ.text: Thai House is my go-to Thai place in south Charlotte. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Lots of vegetarian/vegan options. Delicious, with good service.

sAXMuwyD-CzgbINhjpzW8A.text: Saw this was close to work and decided to try it based on Yelp reviews. I also did not order the pad thai because it was not rated very highly here. The ladies were patient and I read over the menu.  I ordered spring rolls, dumplings, and the yellow curry. Spring rolls were good but very greasy. The dumplings were served with a hair on them so I sent them back. They brought new ones and they were pretty good but salty. The yellow curry was good but not great.... maybe I needed to order it with more spice? I was not asked what spice level I wanted so maybe they just gave me not spicy. The portions were decent and I have enough to feed my husband dinner. Overall for a first experience it was alright. Total was about $30 with tip.  The hair in the food and the food only being okay means I will spend my $30 elsewhere next time.

OY8UDiPrDElDyf22QNMHGA.text: Are you kidding? Eat here!   I have been a fan of the Indian restaurant next door for a while, but today I just thought I'd try this place.  A lovely find!  Their steamed spring rolls are definitely different from what you expect- not bad- just different. I've had a lot of Thai and this is a unique take for sure. Peppery, and nice.  I got a yellow curry- it's exactly what it should be- fresh, spicy, a little sweet, and tasty. Not a ton of food, but just enough. It was delightful.  At this price point it's hard to beat this place. Some places will serve you beautiful dishes with orchids on the plate etc, but this place just serves the tasty meal (without the orchid, without having to break into the kid's college fund).  Yep. Do it.

UkDFM-cdWGeOrjucHgOk5w.text: Waited 15 minutes for host to acknowledge us the swiftly told " a few minutes" once we inform her of our party size.  Walked out after waiting 10 minutes.  They need more help on dining room floor.

0mvUxZNq0n3dqM0iBnid8g.text: Great food!  Great Service! Lovely ambience!  Best pad thai ever. Red curry was spicy and full of flavors.

oiG1Jfv2Ke9X9Rv_-O5XZg.text: Not bad for Thai food if your in the area. Offers decent lunch specials that include soup, a spring roll and a drink for usually under $10. Dinners can get a bit pricey. The duck panang is my fave thing on the menu. Its a solid curry dish with tender duck  breaded and deep fried. Not my #1 duck panang but it was my first so gotta give them credit for that. It is pretty good. The house salad makes for a great cheap lunch. Its $5.50 for fresh lettuce, bean sprouts, chunks of pineapple, fried tofu, tomatoes and onions. Served with a spice/sweet/peanut/ginger dressing. YUM. Also the spring rolls are  delicious. I've eaten in and grabbed to-go numerous times over the years and service is always acceptable. When i have gone with others everyone in the party seems to enjoy their food. Overall an A-ok place to eat.

4SC6OvBqVw30_7_Bji23DA.text: Exquisite. Beautiful interior, excellent food, and friendly service. Coconut curry shrimp was outstanding. Go. Go now.

Idu8R4aJgOE332NMwhXVIg.text: Two things hit me when I walked in here.  The decor and the delicious smell.  First off the elaborate wood carvings and other ornate decorations really set the mood for a good meal.  Then there was the food itself.  It was actually pretty good, even though I'm not usually a big fan of food with a lot of spice. But if that's your thing go for it.  I had a lot of fun here, and I'll certainly be back to try some more.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

dj6GNXuj4_X87U4EwJMxkQ.text: This is one of my favorite thai restaurants. Best pad thai in town. The food and service is always great and they have huge portions. I am a big fan of art and mainly oriental artwork and this place is full of it. The wood work in this place is unreal. Even if you do not like Thai and appreciate good artwork I would strongly recommend going into this restaurant and checking it out.

9l33VYcxssbo0z1QUWBwYA.text: I lunch there a few weeks ago and enjoyed it so we decided to try dinner  last night.  We were impressed with the fast and attentive service, the authentic clothing the waitstaff wears and the food.  YUM!  We began with the chicken Satay as an appetizer, so tender and yummy, Gulf of Siam with shrimp as the main course. Lots of delicious flavors, very appealing to the eye and the rice was perfect.  Of course we had warm Sake.  A little pricey, good parking, I will be back.

ogx2u2Yya6A94UQh72IpTQ.text: This used to be our go-to place for Thai, eating there t least twice a month. But over the past year, the quality of food has declined. Not just the entrees -- even the previously CRAZY GOOD dipping sauce for spring rolls has declined.  My heart is still with them, but I only go here once in a while now given the change.  I sincerely hope they return to their better days, as there is new competition in S Chl now.

1A3lB_ken33Bm3hMwqZKpA.text: Went again this past weekend and it's official- I'm in love! Excellent Pad Thai, and their house soups are pretty great too!

bMP6R0qBDIyjM8yMiOJJAw.text: Hubby loves this place...I however do not really care too much for it. The curries are too sweet and their stirfry's are always packed with too much cabbage! and I mean raw cabbage. I also don't understand how they expect us to eat dry stirfry with rice.  We eat here if hubby has serious thai food hankering and I have decided to stick with their noodles which are actually decent.

nMHGUpEfhSCvFcwg2Eobbg.text: Not good.  Monsoon beats this  place X ten.  Phad thai like mush.  Bland.  Doesn't look or taste like it was prepared by Thai cooks.

e3z-Qj4hfopbNPGPTh8s-w.text: Went there for my Birthday along with my friends. We went at 9.30 and they said the last order would be taken by 9.45 . We took quite sometime to decide and they were not polite to watch us scanning the menu.  Food was good, the Rice Wine Saki too was good. Overall food is good and you can go there for a simple evening but don't expect anything special.

V_ImMvWOcrfi1fwQgVVfNw.text: I hope that this review does not get filtered, as I am a fan of this restaurant. It is quick, so I can get in and out for lunch, the prices are good, and the food is really delicious. Staff is efficient and friendly. The parking is never bad which is nice when you are trying to be quick.

pqHq3Y-Ks84aemKlVUU3zQ.text: Best thai I've ate in a long time.

4sFoV25N4TyRAu1aNMr-9A.text: This place is awesome!  I've been eating here for 5 years and it is consistently good every time.  The one taller young guy is the friendliest guy you'll meet and gets the order right.  The soups are great, the fried rice dishes are great, and the curry dishes are delicious.  Charlotte needs more restaurants like this one.

6P0lGzKgQEeswLYzcRGZgw.text: This is the best Thai I've had in Charlotte. It's a nice, quiet place to go after work, the food is always fresh and the staff is very friendly. Great pad thai and green beans and tofu!

qrih_epeSCTUskZchf1ySg.text: I stopped into Thai House for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  The restaurant wasn't very busy and I was seated right away.  The decor is very interesting, carved wood everywhere with a carved log sculpture dominating the center of the restaurant.  My server came over and took my drink order.  Shortly after another server brought a bowl of chicken soup which was OK.  It took a little bit for my server to come back to take my order, but I had the chicken soup to slurp on while I waited.  I ordered the chicken pad Thai along with an order of steamed spring rolls.  The spring rolls weren't like the typical ones I've gotten in other Thai restaurants.  They had tofu instead of shrimp and the wrapper wasn't the translucent rice wrapper other places use.  The spring rolls were OK, but I wouldn't order them again.  The pad Thai came out shortly after I finished the spring rolls.  It looked good and OK tasting.  The lunch prices were very reasonable, $7.95 for the pad Thai. The service was OK, the food was OK, I guess that makes Thai House an OK place to eat.

5PONp5wMB5aIWDIjB2m8Nw.text: I've been here a few times and it was pretty decent. The food is alright, a little oversauced at times which I'm not a big fan of. The only problem I have with it is that they give you a huge bowl of curry with a small scoop of rice, and when you ask for more rice, they charge you 1.50 a bowl! Either give larger portions of rice with a dinner-sized curry entree, or cut down on the portions, it's RIDICULOUS that I have to spend up to an extra 3 bucks just to have enough rice for my entree.

zlCiuFhCOkLyvW-ogQaS_Q.text: We love to come here for family dinners .  Their food is always delicious.  I think they recently switch management (I'm not 100% sure), bc i noticed some new faces or could be the day I went I'm not sure. But even before, the service there is usually good .  Would recommend!

KZcJgA6dkqFpUeKBpelCzA.text: Stopped in for lunch today...and thought I should bring up a few things.  First of all, the food was fail-proof...always so delicious! I tried one of my faves, Pad See Ew w/ Chicken & Shrimp ($2 add-on with extra meat), which also came with complimentary soup and spring roll...just $12.90 total for all this! Of course, I had to have their Thai Iced Tea, which bumped up the bill a bit...but all quite reasonable! Still, I must say, for the $2 extra, I thought they were skimpy on the Shrimp... As you'll see in my pic, it was mostly Chicken, just a few Shrimp on the bottom. Think I'll skip on adding Shrimp next time.  As always, the service was also spot on. Fast, friendly, and seamless!  The issue that I DID have this time around was the A/C...or the lack thereof. It was a super hot-n-humid kind of day, and just as hot inside. Thanks to super-fast service, I was done within 30-35 minutes, and quickly out the door! Honestly, I couldn't have lasted another minutes inside...yep, it was that bad. A/C has never been an issue on my dinner outings in the past, so not sure if they just shut the A/C down, or had it set at over 70 during the day? Anyway, it didn't work for me...so must dock a star.  Still, like you'll see from my previous reviews, I absolutely LOVE this restaurant...so I'm bound to be back again (and again). I just hope they work on comfortably setting their A/C (to nice and cool) all throughout the day...especially on hot, doggy days during the summer!

Wh07uWc_Ft9BvsEuLoQm0g.text: First time checking this place out after years of passing by. While the strip mall exterior is blah the interior is warm and welcoming, service the same! Menu is very large and covers all the bases - standouts were the Pad Thai and the King of Siam fish curry, gingery and bursting with fresh flavors !  On a related note they were very attentive to my wife's gluten allergy which was appreciated !

Rr1R7-09ZHa-GXtn5QoA2Q.text: I have been going to this Thai house for about 10 years, it does not ever disappoint me. There have been a few changes since the last time I came though. They have gotten rid of the pretty China Condiment tray. They now have a bottle of Thai Chili sauce on the table. They are fast and efficient and the food is very good. We stopped in last night before a movie so we just had appetizers. We ordered Chicken Satee' which is grilled with a great peanut sauce. We had Shrimp tempura, which also has about 6 pieces of fried vegetables and six good size shrimp. But the only negative was the Potstickers, which were not Potstickers. They were a wonton skin filled with a pureed Spinach. Not like any Potsticker I have ever had. Not the best. All their other dishes and soups and rices are delicious. Stop in and try this Thai House !

BLMAdOEn_TRV_8NDMf6pkQ.text: This little place has the most delicious yellow curry. I had mine with chicken, thinly sliced, with potatoes and onion in a savory, creamy yellow curry broth. Served with rice. It was great. Had a Thai beer as well. Pretty good.

LKax6st47G6wytWMpSwpwQ.text: I have seen this place for years never went. Finally on a rainy nightI went for dinner. Where has this place been lol The soup was amazing I would have tried the soup made with coconut milk with chicken n tomatoes . I see this soup in my future for winter.   I ordered the shrimp with rice the shrimp was cooked perfectly :) Now one thing service was not the best  it could have been an off night but they were not busy. But I will go back if your out on pineville matthews give this place a try :)

X9dizxXP_R8BQ_nX_e5WBQ.text: I had dinner last night everything was good the food, service, good quality and quantity. It's our favorite restaurant authentic Thai food keep it up  God bless you

i8y9NFy8n7mDfMo_pU6apA.text: I'm always looking for good Thai food and I finally found it. Parking is easy as they are in a shopping plaza. I stopped in just to grab some pad thai and enjoyed it. One of the best in the area.   I just grabbed to go so I'll be back to get the full dining experience. The atmosphere and staffed seemed fine. They also have another location in Northern Charlotte.

PHvIGjHRPyVZnKAl4_x2OQ.text: When I was in middle school, my best friend's mom worked with a Thai lady. Occasionally she would make large batches of chicken in a Thai sauce and I got to eat some. I loved it. Thai House took me back to that moment as the pad krapraw tastes just like her dish.   I like this restaurant. There's very intricate wood carvings, some in shapes of elephants that transport you to another place. We had a nice quiet booth and there was no wait on a Friday night. Our server may have also been a manager. He was super friendly, attentive and made us laugh a few times.   The food is authentic and flavorful. We ordered the knock out rolls with shrimp which were basically summer rolls. Loved these. It wasn't just filled with rice noodles like other places. Plenty of crunchy veggies, decent sized shrimp and of course basil. The peanut dipping sauce was the right of amount of sweetness and paired well with the rolls. I ordered the pad krapraw with brown rice and hubby got the classic pad Thai in brown sauce. We both were asked the level of spiciness. He went with a medium and I went with hot. The portion sizes are good. My meal was enough for two. Now back to that pad krapraw. It's chopped chicken which I wasn't used to, but cooked in that sauce, I was in heaven. The sauce is a bunch of things, savory, sweet, spicy with a touch of basil. I love it. I wanted more sauce to drown my rice in. While it was very good, I could have used more spice. I didn't think it was "hot" spicy. Now I know for next time to get "extra hot." Hubby enjoyed his meal, too.   I want to come back to try some other dishes, but Thai House has been added to our date night list.

MC7zApX-FHjOLkMr9gtRYw.text: I ordered the chicken Pad Thai (Thai style) and it was just okay compared to other places I have had the same dish. The chicken in the dish was dry and had some hard parts. I did not order anything else though. The atmosphere was nice and they had very elaborate decor in the dining room.The bathroom was another story. It needed one toilet to be repaired and the other one had a broken toilet paper roll. They need to update their bathrooms.

GmBFuBsbOoL1KP-Q4GfPaQ.text: What's not to love about this restaurant? We were promptly seated and told about the restaurant specials and menu choices. Our server was very nice and answered any questions we had.  The food was hot and authentic. Not all Thai places serve Thai coffee or Thai tea, but they do here, and it was absolutely perfect (right balance and not too sweet).  Food choices - you can't go wrong. Thai House is one of the best in the area. Decor is tasteful and the restaurant has a nice elegant feel about it. Prices are very fair.  We left more than satisfied and full. We're definitely going back SOON.

C4zaglylKeAA1BHz0Lq9Ug.text: Thai House has been around for many years so at this point it's pretty much a Charlotte institution. This location is decorated very nicely with lots of carved wood all over. The food is quite good but not necessarily the best I've had in Charlotte. Some dishes that I recommend are the Pad Krapraw, the Red Curry, the Yellow Curry and the Pad Khing. They have lunch specials Monday through Friday 11 AM to 2:45 PM except holidays.

FeEDrjxRVGew2H73ESswsA.text: So much disappointed with my pad thai order recently. Picked up and ate at home. Understandable when the noddle got stuck together a bit after pick up. But the sauce tastes like too much ketchup.(you can see that reddish  color from the photo) Didn't know they put the ketchup for the pad thai! I enjoyed their other dishes before but I feel bad about their disappointing pad thai:( My husband told me it was better than this when he ordered pad thai here before. Maybe the chef was on vacation on the day or they changed a chef?! The green curry we order was okay though. It is a hit spicy so you should know it before you order.

Kr0-8sGZnM10vAqF66zGDQ.text: The host ignored us, the whole time we waited without putting us on a wait list, despite nobody waiting. We had to leave the restaurant after some time. It looks the place is poorly managed. Also the sanitation score was low. Never going back to Thai house Pineville again!

TcVr1H97ok0eRt7B8BPeig.text: (1/11/19) My wife asked me where I wanted to eat dinner this evening and I told her that I wanted Asian cuisine. She then wanted to know what restaurant I wanted to go to. I named a few in our neighborhood but we settled on Thai House.  I was interested in seeing what their vegetarian options are. I've ordered steamed spring rolls, golden shrimp and a soup called poh tak, followed by a vegetarian yellow curry. We'll see how good they are.  Well the shrimp were hot and flavorful. The steamed spring rolls had a lot of dough to them but not much on the inside. The dipping sauce was nice though. The poh tak was a lemongrass and chili based soup with tomatoes and seafood. It was quite good. The vegetarian yellow curry was also quite good. It was a good balance between sweet and hot with plenty of different vegetables. All in all a very good place to dine if one is looking for vegetarian food.

IvvPGprKfrP5g1EI2-onaA.text: This is the best Thai in south Charlotte. If you like Thai this will be your place.  Excellent tea, food service, great food.  A must try

L4PniOcXQ3t0OZzMCMSA8Q.text: The food was so so sooo good and the staff was wonderful. I left with my stomach full and a big smile on my face! I would most definitely recommend.  The atmosphere is also great.  Thank you so much!!!!

H0CvV8Lq56WFq6XkTMS-zw.text: Meet up with a friend for lunch, loved the decorations in the restaurant, service was good, Thai tea was great, but the food was so so. I had the chicken pad thai, over all was too sweet for my taste.
