2V_Ip9VU8chErgorBCEKCw.text: The waiters are very courteous unlike like their University location.  The taste is outstanding and the service is excellent. Would go again to this location but would avoid the university location.

2TI-eCFNKTha5P5rHnw3-A.text: Got some takeout from Thai House as we were passing thru Charlotte on vacation. Not sure why this place has such good reviews. The pad thai was really gross...a pile of stuck together broken noodles with what tasted like ketchup & hardly any veggies or tofu. I had a few bites & threw it out. So disappointed. My husband got the veggie green curry which was a little better, but nothing special. Wish we would've tried a different restaurant.

gM82tNTuzjze3UsyX1_pxQ.text: This is the best Thai that you will find in Charlotte. The cuisine is authentic, and always delightful, and the service is superb. Six days out of seven, there will be no wait when you show up, so of course reservations aren't necessary. The longest I have ever had to wait at this restaurant was ten minutes tops. To compliment the Thai theme, the restaurant is beautifully decorated, everything very tasteful and not overdone. The wood carvings along the walls are interesting to behold, and the music is soothing, but not overpowering to conversation.   The Thai House is versatile as far as occasion is concerned; it serves well for dinner dates, but equally well for business lunches. Though I would recommend business casual attire, the servers never look down at customers in jeans or casual clothes. They are always friendly, and happy to please everyone.   At lunch time, along with your entree, you are served a soup of the day which is always light and refreshing, and a fried spring roll. The sweet orange sauce that you dip this spring roll in is to die for. I could make a meal on those spring rolls alone.   Nearly every time I dine at this restaurant, I order the Sweet Jasmine Tea-- absolutely delicious. And although many people recognize Thai food for Pad Thai, PLEASE be adventurous and try some of the curry dishes. My absolute favorite is called Panang Neur (with chicken): this has coconut milk, crushed peanuts and bell peppers over rice. When you are served this dish, it will look like soup-- simply dump the white rice on your plate, and spoon out as much of the chicken, bell peppers, and curried liquid over the rice as you please. This is a SPECIAL TREAT.   Unfortunately, the above entree is extremely addicting, and you will find yourself craving Thai House curry dishes on the regular. Hope you enjoy it as much as I do!   PS  As far as price range is concerned, lunch is very affordable, $10 or less. Dinner dishes range from $12-14 and up, but the food is ALWAYS worth it.

N_vVE_92WDebDvmQnaFJTw.text: Nice Atmosphere, Delicious Thai Food. I am picky when it comes to Thai food but this place is awesome. I highly recommend it.

fey1zkzibr-p0URbP16y3Q.text: Stopped by for lunch today.  Except I didn't realize they don't serve lunch on the weekends.  They serve brunch.  The single sided paper menu offered ten to twelve different options to choose from, none of which I was jonesing for.  C'est la vie!  I had the pineapple curry with chicken.  It included a fried egg roll and a bowl of soup, for $8.99.  The price was right and the entree was tasty, but other two items were "just a bit outside."  The soup was nothing I was familiar with, but consisted of one piece of dry chicken, a couple of pieces of carrots, and a plethora of cabbage.  It was nothing exciting.  Nor was the egg roll.  But the entree was good.  It was red curry based and had some solid flavor.  I enjoyed it a lot.   The service was good.  When I placed my order, the gentleman let me know that it was going to be a little bit spicy.  I told him that I was okay with that, but I appreciated the warning.  Drinks were filled promptly, and the check was brought in a relatively timely manner.  I might try to go back when there they are serving their full menu, to try the dish I was looking for.

twh0MSaQ_buJxAjGs4OhIw.text: Absolutely love this place. Great service and the yellow chicken curry is perfect every time. We love their fried strips of chicken to dip in curry sauce. Duck is amazing and the pat-see-yew is always good

ZPeLgXE9KC1di3AFTTpP5w.text: Fellow Yelper Elisa S. & I have been here 2 times in 7 days for lunch - that's how MMMMM this place is! The lunch specials are just hands down hard to beat. With soup, spring roll in duck sauce and an entree, I've tried the red curry with chicken and the pad thai with chicken and both made me go "ohhhh, yum!".  Having never had Thai before this, I am not sure how much I can really speak to the spices, authenticity, or things like that but here's the rundown:  1. Place is AUTHENTIC looking, with all the ornate wood carving it's just a cool place! 2. Waiters are very helpful and attentive 3. The tea they have is minty - yummy and refreshing 4. Every meal I had I've loved - it just takes great! 5. BOGO in Entertainment Books ROCK!  I will keep going back long after the coupons end... :)

lmVzpLjor575e4cmFZLqsw.text: Below average and I will not return. The shrimp in two dishes did not taste fresh and were not deveined. I got 4 items: knock out rolls made with shrimp (instead of tofu) (shrimp not good), pot stickers (too salty in the interior with very little filling), chicken pad thai (not bad but definitely below average compared to other Thai places I've been to, and the worst of the dishes the shrimp fried rice (the bad tasting shrimp ruined the dish entirely, and no egg was in the rice as it states it should be in there on the menu).  I threw out the rice but was able to eat the remaining items.

1JIlkaNe4_P7VMD-lAJpNw.text: I've been going to the Thai House about once a month for over a year now. I love it! I've tried a number of other Thai restaurants in the area and this is my favorite.  I often bring friends and no one has ever disliked their meal here. My favorite things to get are the Pho and the Green Curry (which is really spicy). The food is always great.   The service is even better than the food. They are always prompt and friendly. Most times I am surprised at how fast the food comes out. After going here a while they treat you like family. I would definitely recommend it to others!

OHNq6PKjigAS5k5fKnYKaA.text: Delicious Thai food in South Charlotte.  This place is good for lunch, dinner and take-out.  Be sure to tell them how spicy you want it - sometimes they ask your preference on a scale of one to four, or low/medium/high.  (Hint: "medium" packs a punch!)    The service is usually good, though a couple of times they didn't come around to my table fast enough to refill my tea.  (If I remember, I'll sometimes tell the waiter, "Your tip is tied to my glass of tea!")  Their spring rolls are good, and the Pad Thai is the best I've had anywhere.   Tips: - Parking is good. - Mentally drained from work?  When you leave the office, call Thai House with your take-out order and it will be ready by the time you get to the restaurant. Take-out is usually ready in 10-15 minutes, maybe 20 if they're packed.

3OuV7isW18i1QKEevPj_Bg.text: I was actually looking for Viet Thai, but it is hidden and came across Thai House in Pineville, NC.  Good luck on my part.  Authenic decor, friendly service and great food.  My Tom Yum shripm soup had four large shrimp, peeled to the tail.  The chicken panang curry was flavorful and spicy withou adding spices.  I tried Chang beer instead of my usual Singha...not as good IMHO, but OK.  There are 5-6 choices for Thai in the Pineville area and Thai House is a good one.  Check it out.  Pat

3vhc9qEvLUhEHDbX4JcIsg.text: I ordered vegetarian pad Thai and if was pretty tasteless, even when I asked for extra peanuts. I ate it just because I was hungry. The decor in the restaurant was nice though. Just wish the food was better

i2d4jzIMIE6oQQr1VPKB4w.text: We really like this place.  I think it's not only the best Thai food I have had here in Charlotte, but I also find that it's better than most Thai restaurants I experience when I travel (so far there is only one place I found that's better, but it's in Petaluma, CA... so bit of a drive for a quick dinner ;-)  I have tried numerous items on their menu and have never been disappointed.  Service has always been friendly and prompt.   This will continue to be our "go-to" Thai in Charlotte.

xMdp4kvqp9TLE5ASJf1McQ.text: I've ordered their pad thai for take out a couple of times from this place, but last night was the first night that my husband and I decided to go dine in at this place. It was a BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!! The service here is HORRIBLE!!   We went there around 9pm and was the only couple there besides another group at the place. The other group left shortly after we came, but we never got service after we received our food. We never got asked if we needed anything else and received no water refill. They had 6 staff walking around working and doing their own thing and NOT ONE of them ever even stop to come check on us especially our waitress. When we finally got up to leave she was talking out loud from the far back asking us if everything was okay. I wanted to throw a fit and say.. "no, everything is not okay we got no service!"   Aside from the poor customer service; we ordered my favorite dish which was the pad thai. I asked for no onions and bean sprouts, but we still got it with LOTS of big onions and bean sprouts. My husband told me to say something about it; but I figure I would deal w/ it because I'm always iffy about what people do with my food after they take it back and have to fix it for me. It already took about 15 minutes or so for them to bring out the dish and I didn't want to have to wait another 15 minutes.   We also ordered sticky rice..and I LOVE sticky rice. It took them longer to bring us the sticky rice than the other three dishes that we ordered. The sticky rice was not moist and sticky at all. It was dried and crusty like its been sitting out for too long. I guess they were trying to microwave or steam it before they brought it out, but didn't do a very good job.  We also ordered the green curry dish; that dish cost $13.95 and came in such a small size plate that should have been worth $7 at the most! Big disappointment on that dish.   So base on my experience last night; I have concluded that I will NEVER go here again nor will I even bother to order take out from this place. Bangkok Ocha down the street is so much better!

AZzcsz0vet7lCOKrAxZLcQ.text: Great food for the price.  I enjoyed their vegetarian options especially the pad Thai. Love the inside. Great service as well.

ySWJQRrGnuZQIub4ECjhBQ.text: Not sure why the $$ this place is over priced and bad bland food. 12.95 for beef basil? They don't use real Thai chili peppers, I like spicy and asked for it. They sprinkle Nasty old chill powder which ruined the dish. No flavor and not worth $12.95   Skip this place.  Also called to let them know: response was " ok, is there anything else I can do for you??????????"  Wow what rude jerks!!!!!!!

1SV8qWu7AKa_I1RG2lEWkA.text: Thai House was my favorite Thai restaurant in Charlotte. Their food is fresh, spiced to order, and delicious. Portions are huge, so I always had leftovers for lunch the next day. Try the spring rolls- delicious!   The decor in Thai House is beautiful, and the waitstaff wear traditional dress. They are friendly and attentive, and I always enjoyed my meals here. They occasionally offer promotions in the area, which are a great way to save some money. They also have a weekend lunch menu that features some of their classics at a great price.   I would recommend Thai house to anyone who loves Thai, or those who want to try!

njHkKA-qGOhLb3pASV_SyA.text: The menu is great. There are so many options to choose from. I love all of their rice dishes. The garlic and ginger chicken is yummy. The lard nar is really flavorful. I also tried their fried tilapia with vegetables and it was superb. The servers are so cute in their Thai outfits. They are really friendly as well. The prices are good, they have great deals for lunch. You have to try it.

42Uiuo6dmeyPFIj8V65NRQ.text: It's a decent restaurant with some delicate decoration. Dined in twice and both were pretty good. Helpful server with abundant food knowledge. Recommend to anyone who likes Thai.

yUdLjkVoLRIoS2GPnUB2Zw.text: A great place for Thai foods! Awesome staffs and wicked foods ( wicked =awesome)! Went there yesterday and order curry duck dish ( dont know the name though) it was soo good! Prob one few best Thai restaurant in charlotte! :)

E2dHQpi5NyLW7r0W48hfyg.text: There are a couple of amazing wood sculptures in the place.  The food however, is not as noteable.  The food is average or typical of Thai cuisine.  The dishes are standard and taste and look like what thai food should, however, nothing stood out as being anything more than average.  I am wondering if I am being to critical and if yelp should have 2 rating systems.  1 rating for how a place might compare against local establishments, and another rating for the restaurant nationally.  With that in mind, of the 2 places in Charlotte I have tried for thai, this is clearly the better.

ntqSPmSI24MsfUoKX3AQ5w.text: We have visited this place now couple of times. The folks are very cheerful here and the wooden sculpture of chain of elephants is cool. On our quest for finding places that offer vegetarian choices, we tried this place. The pretty much make anything vegetarian, by replacing a tofu equivalent, which worked out very well for us. We tried the PadKraPraw with a tofu replacement and this was very flavorful and hit the right taste buds. I am slowly beginning to become a fan of this place.

oMKeW10-4a25PkEmQ9KY8Q.text: I've been coming here since I was a kid. I went recently with my family. The food was great and the appetizer was good too. Come check this place out soon if you are interested in trying new foods besides burgers and fries.

LgoGaktLSsINAL9yu-uOlA.text: I've been coming here for years. The prices are fair, the portions are reasonable and the taste is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hours of Operation

yfH-gt9BuNc-k7AfMlqMUA.text: Incredible consistent Thai food.  Authentic as far as I can tell.  Great Thai Tea.  A must eat charlotte place for sure.

rqHZIVgOUilpfdl3p56RCQ.text: Rude staff, tried to take away the menu before I finished ordering. Asked for desert and gave us the check instead.  Food is nothing special. Had better Thai food elsewhere.

guR4zgyz7hcSXDkWbpcQBQ.text: I was so excited to see a Thai House near my new job because I go to the Thai House University location all the time. While the University location is amazing, I quickly found out that this location is anything but.  The first time I ordered lunch, I received a dish that was way too salty. I didn't save the leftovers. I ALWAYS keep my University Thai House leftovers for a second meal.  I thought maybe it was a fluke, and decided to give them a second chance.  Ordered again today- even worse than my first lunch. My chicken pad thai tasted too sweet. Another yelp'ers description of it tasting like ketchup is not far off.  The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The spring roll is slightly burnt and the chicken rubbery. To top it all off, the man who gave me my food had a bad attitude. Considering I was simply waiting for my food patiently, no grumpiness was needed.  Never going here again, though the other location I will continue to go to regularly as they have delicious food and super friendly staff.

ycZUzRPu_aj6jWTwitDPEw.text: We loved our Thai place in Boston and really missed having someplace to go get Pad Thai. We moved into the area and found this place and fell in love with it.  The inside of the restaurant is beautiful and really clean. The staff are all really nice and attentive. They have takeout, which works for us since we live a few blocks away.  I thought the food was great. We've tried a few different meals. My wife does not enjoy very spicy food and the mild versions suit her fine. I do like my food spicy and if I had one complaint it's that I wouldn't mind if the spicy dishes were a little hotter than what I've experienced so far. The food has great flavors and think it is spot on.

H1fN9QAfVlJybJFPxu4F4Q.text: This is by far my favorite Thai restaurant!! They have the best spring rolls and the best Pad Thai. The service is excellent and always consistent. I can never get enough of the jasmine tea!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai

bP0EFc5b0J1y32G7fcIBaQ.text: I would give them five for great customer service and the awesome food!! If you love Thai food then this is a must try. Me and my sister when on Saturday evening to have lunch there and it was amazing. My sister order a dish and then figured that it was to spicy and she cant eat it. When our waitress came to check we told her that it was to spicy. They took her dish and made her a  new one.. Really it wasn't there fault cause my sister should have read the ingredients but it was very nice of them to do that..

wy_YshBA0GSmplnk8wH9OA.text: Awesome place to grab some spicy, or not so spicy, Thai food. Sometimes service is slow or not so attentive, but I have never been in a hurry while there anyway. so not a huge deal. I always look forward to the Namprigpaow or Red Curry. If you do the tofu instead of meat, you get veggies like broccoli with your meal. I think the tofu is better than the other protein here.I prefer going for lunch since dinner is about the same portion and costs significantly more. Gotta try the Knock Out Rolls which are an appetizer; fresh roll, vegetables, basil leaves and tofu wrapped in rice sheets and served with plum sauce. So refreshing.

AQmmCjri-HS8c5RGwIalRA.text: Not my favorite place, but you know what, the service is good, the pad see ew is legit and plentiful, and the curries are OK.   3 stars because if you want to order green curry for lunch, you have to pay dinner prices for ($14! WHAT!?). There was an abundance of rice and chicken, but I didn't think it was salty enough. Next time I guess I would try the Red curry for lunch, or the Mussaman if I'm ever here on a Friday (available for lunch only Fridays).  This is odd, but I really really like the free soup that comes with lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Summer Rolls

L-QigRhkD1VTmkQVqzn_ig.text: Loved the atmosphere, the decor, the service and the food! Charlene had the Green Curry with chicken - medium spicy, and I had Basil Fried Rice with beef - 4 spicy on a scale of 5. We are very happy with our entire experience, and it was about as good as we've had in our favorite places in So. California. You want good Thai and a great authentic atmosphere- come eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main dining room view
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Basil fried rice and Green Curry.

szdv_10j7hxM9czfTs47XA.text: I love Asian food and am always looking for me places. This is a very nice new addition. The decor is nice, a bit formal but not so much that you feel underdressed in jeans.   The service was good with everyone checking on you as they walked by.   The beef Satay appetizer was excellent. I could have ordered more and made a meal of just that.

Klr1iC8I5863tImEjGKG9Q.text: I LOVE great Thai food and I have eaten here a few times, though this last meal was the best this place has done so far!  The service was great and the Decor in nicer than most Thai Restaurants.  Tom Yum Soup 3.5 yelp stars.  Red Curry with Chicken 4.25 stars.  Mango with Sticky Rice for Dessert 2.90 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spice Tray
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango with Sticky Rice
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Curry with Chicken

rvkGo3gTUHt5cqqpD_DGJw.text: This place is authentic.  I loved it. As a person who has been all over the world and had authentic flavors from several countries, this place took me back. It is nice to have a restaurant that makes and prepares their food in house.

UkgDUdvq3Q0VkcutAO1UBg.text: Tonight we ordered take-out... my husband ordered- veggie red curry and I ordered Massaman curry with chicken (substituted potatoes with more veggies). Both of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals! My Massaman curry had just the right amount of sweet and spicy! My husband said the smoky/spicy balance was just right in his red curry as well. Neither one of us are big rice eaters (watching our carbs) but we both continued to eat rice with sauce, after the veggies and protein were gone, JUST to keep the flavor in our mouths...

ucp-lAJOhu2e31bbxmDMRg.text: Worse pad Thai I have ever had! Big mess of tasteless nothing all soggy and mushy! Never been there before and never going back!!

DFWQRo67-ywYvVwbotFJQg.text: Delicious!!!!! Service good, restaurant decor is really unique. Wouldn't have picked this place necessarily by outside looks, but don't let the cover fool you!! It's in a strip mall and looks like your run of the mill everyday restaurant, but once you step inside you'll be transported to Thailand.  You really should do yourself a favor and check this place out....you won't be disappointed!

N2c62ZeDrxkVRNKQR_DRIA.text: Sweet and sour chicken. Great if you like deep fried- hardly any chicken inside. Broccoli slightly brown tops. Sauce not sweet or sour just there.... Hope for good based on reviews. Disappointed but I'll eat it

bK8KvzeMSyQsfYTDu9Xs5g.text: I'm sad because this was my favorite Thai restaurant. I took my son there for New Year's day and he got a steamed bug in his food. The food is excellent and the staff is hit or miss.

jdMv7K9Ez_vu0suYzNf0tQ.text: Food is super tasty!  Delicious flavors and textures.  Just the right amount of sauces and curries per dish.  I ordered the Vegetarian Yellow Curry, which was top notch perfect!  I don't remember what my parents ordered, but they were equally as delighted and satisfied as I was.  I cannot wait to return.  Also, the ambiance and decor inside is really nice!  I like the detailed woodwork and artwork.  Family run!

moUK7Z7OLUW1CkVu1cUTXA.text: Absolutely delicious food. Even soup was brought out to us before our lunch meal. Everything was served hot, fresh, and quick. The waitresses and waiters wear traditional Thai clothing. Absolutely loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh shrimp rolls
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Curry Chicken

KQOJazcZ7_cvHWYWjbLH9w.text: Had a fantastic Christmas dinner! Food as always was great, and the service was excellent for a busy Christmas evening (all the staff worked together to make sure we had everything we needed)!  Thai House is going to be our new Christmas tradition

D0ptMXjmc-dMbJ8HI0Jamg.text: I am so happy for the existence of this place. This is my favorite charlotte thai food restaurant. The curry fried rice and basil fried rice were on point. Spice level was just right and hot the spot. Staff was friendly and very warm. Loved the crispy spring rolls too. Decor is so pretty can't wait to come back

KqBXj79t30FmpdSiqkr75g.text: A friend and I came here for dinner and when I tell you the veggie pineapple fried rice is EVERYTHING.  Just the right amount of savory and sweet; the broccoli wasn't overdone--it was a bit crisp just like I like them.  Nice restaurant and very friendly staff.

R6DG-2jpo5Y0qsHo7bmklw.text: We just had the worst possible experience in a restaurant. We love Thai food and we're looking at places to eat. We thought we found our Thai rest but we were in for a big surprise. We order pad Thai and it was so dry and tasteless. The waitress offered to bring me something else and my husband kept eating even though he hated it. A second waitress offered to bring him something also. I told him to do it. All of a sudden an old man came out of the kitchen yelling at My husband like he was a child basically saying that he took More than one Bite and should not get another dish. We were outraged. How nasty can you get. The waitresses apologized for him but it didn't matter we spent $45 to throw food in the garbage. I would not suggest eating this food. I'm sick to my stomach

DkaDqngz4ZqTFE0O5XssVA.text: This is really a 4.5. Excellent as always. We always do a red curry and a masaman curry, and it never disappoints.    A little light on the veggies in the masaman which is why it wasn't a perfect review

xwiG550b5WMffhCewOzBlg.text: This place is seriously becoming my favorite Thai place in Charlotte.  When I come here for lunch, I am never disappointed.  Even when the restaurant is busy, the staff has been friendly, the food comes out fast, the service is superb and the food is always flavorful and fresh.  I usually get the Namprigpaow or Pad Krapraw with chicken, no rice and extra spice.  My belly and tastebuds are always happy.  This is comfort food at its best!   Lunch also comes with soup and a spring roll.  The soup varies from day to day.  Also their iced tea is jasmine tea...sweet or unsweet.   I love jasmine tea!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Khing
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

1Q8gpvHxUXHd9gTNo2-SeQ.text: I've been here 3 times this week and really love the fresh flavorful dishes! The food is delicious and the staff is so friendly... I'm going to miss this place when I have to fly home.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. #32 on the menu
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. #41 on the meme

LGwfMvMP_CCwfxU0ltJ0xw.text: Pineapple fried rice was delicious! Ordered with the chicken but I will probably try something other than chicken next time. (It was cooked well just dull on flavor.) But the rice by itself was enough to be amazing and I surprised myself by eating the entire plate.

QlfG_P-TS5Kozx_Wq6HAug.text: I figured out the mystery with the Pad Thai dish. When you order you have to request the brown sauce.   Today I ordered Pad Kah soup and added red pepper chili sauce... yum. I ordered the tofu pad thai with brown sauce...wow! Delicious!!!

lx3bMIdPvJ_ppXw6VyCTmQ.text: Great service, great atmosphere, delicious food- we got a noodle dish and a curry dish. SO good. Feels very authentic inside and food also tastes very authentic.

q0VzGuOT-w5U7NjSf_E0wg.text: Outside of building was unassuming as it is located within a strip mall. Service, interior decore and food was amazing, will definitely come again. I recommend the crispy duck, mango sticky rice and cold saki.

vZaf942TVUxbr7GDeTICLA.text: Love me some Thai house mmmm mmmm mmmmmmm and their staff is sweet they even have Apple Pay so who cares if you forget your wallet!!!

PBbhDFJdUS7ebuRa1ggjaQ.text: Went here yesterday for lunch! Their lunch prices and portions are the best!  -First you get some type of soup...they change it every day. We had some type of rice and chicken. It is always broth based. -I ordered the Red Curry Chicken dish. The curry sauce was nice and watery with a creamy cocounut taste. Pour the bowl of chicken and red curry over the rice and then enjoy! The small spring roll was a nice little touch and very good!  They are quick serving and are a great lunch spot option!

DiS5GNVnxVuOSbc6WE6T8w.text: Really liked this place. The food was delicious and well priced. The atmosphere was incredible, and had a very friendly waitstaff!

--IEIWqkLO2EpkpMLWO-Mw.text: Had a very disappointing experience with takeout this evening. Called placed order 20 minutes prior to arrival. Upon arrival, cashier confirmed the order and had me pay for the food. She said food would be right out. I waited 15 minutes and no food arrived. Other take out customers came, picked up three orders and left. No update in my food was given. Went to the hostess desk to inquire but no one present. Finally a harried waitress came to the desk and I asked her to please check on my food since I had been waiting. She scurried off but did not return with food nor information. Hostess finally returns and says  my food would be ready in an additional 15 minutes. Says kitchen mixed up my order. I finally asked for a refund and left.

ooij7GO24npkOnGkd_R9tw.text: We love Thai food & the Thai House doesn't disappoint.  Food is fresh, well seasoned & hot when it arrives to your table. we started our meal with spring rolls. Nicely deep fried with crisp shell. Delicious sweet sauce to dip in.  I had the Pad Kee Mow, AKA Drunken Noodles.  Chicken was grilled nicely before added to the noodles. The vegetables weren't undercooked and the dish wasn't overloaded with veggies vs. meat. Plate presentation was nice.   My wife chose her favorite Red Curry (med heat). Perfect curry seasoning. Excellent meal. Excellent price.    We also had the 3 springs rolls as an appetizer. They were complimented well with the sweet sauce that comes with them.   If you like Thai then I strongly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Kee Mow
Photo of Thai House At Tower Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Curry

ahiGqFk1K0h3-aEie37KXQ.text: I love this place!  I usually order the yellow curry chicken.  HUGE portions and they'll make it as spicy or NOT spicy as you like.

g1tWMq3vGhhxwNOr-OWqSg.text: We came here for an early dinner so it wasn't crowded and were quickly offered a seat and the server was already ready to take our order.  We had to ask for another minute just to look over the standard, yet mesmerizing, menu.    I ordered the Pad Krapraw with brown rice and chopped chicken.  Yes, even for me that was new.  When it came to the table, I even forgot it was chopped and thought there were too many nuts on top.  I was skeptical as I usually prefer the cutlets of chicken and thought they were pulling a fast one on me with substandard meat.  I added the brown rice with the sauce and I couldn't stop eating.  The sweet, garlic and basil flavor really came out and reminded me why Thai is my favorite of Asian food.  I tried to save some to take home for later, but I just had to take more bites.  The prices are reasonable for quality Thai food.  I've tasted much worse in NYC but dishes were less than $10.  Appears they have two other locations in the Charlotte area, so expanding from a small family business suggests that's good news.

xKQNeeIzfK8KR9qcr1zvcw.text: Excellent family run business, great atmosphere and most important, FANTASTIC food.  (P.s the pad Thai is da bomb!)
